name: AzDOCosmosDBUpload
description: When provided a JSON file path in the repository, upload the contents to a Cosmos DB instance
helpMarkDown: For the Endpoint and Primary Key names, enter the name of the variable name. Separately add a reference to the variable group in the YAML file and surround the names in the YAML format - `$(<variable name>)`
author: Hannah K (@mindlessroman)
instanceNameFormat: Upload a JSON file to CosmosDB

inputs.name: cosmosEndpointName
inputs.label: Endpoint Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the variable that contains the URI for the Cosmos instance, as found in 'Keys,' and stored in a variable group

inputs.name: cosmosKeyName
inputs.label: Primary Key Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the variable that contains the primary key for the Cosmos instance, as found in 'Keys,' and stored in a variable group

inputs.name: cosmosDatabase
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The database to which you will connect. If it does not exist, it will be created

inputs.name: cosmosContainer
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The container within the database to which you will connect. If it does not exist, it will be created

inputs.name: cosmosPartition
inputs.label: Partition Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The partition key for the container. If one is not provided Cosmos will default to '/_partitionKey'

inputs.name: fileLocation
inputs.label: JSON File Path in Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the JSON file in the repository. Must be a relative path from `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)`

inputs.name: optInTelemetry
inputs.label: Opt-In for Telemetry?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Opting in will send usage and minimal error problems to help improve the experience
